sessions.title: Registration & Welcome coffee
Keynote
Pragmatic Functional Refactoring with Java 8
sessions.description:
You may be hearing a lot of buzz around functional programming. For example, Java 8 recently introduced new features (lambda expressions and method references) and APIs (Streams, Optional and CompletableFutures) inspired from functional ideas such as first-class functions, composition and immutability. However, what does this mean for my existing codebase?

In this talk we show how you can refactor your traditional object-oriented Java to using FP features and APIs from Java 8 in a beneficial manner. We will discuss things like:

How to adapt to requirement changes using first-class functions.
How you can enhance code reusability using currying.
How you can make your code more robust by favouring immutability over mutability.
How you can reduce null pointer exceptions with Optional.

sessions.title: Adventures in Underland: What Your System Stores on the Disk Without Telling You
sessions.description:
Even though you are the only person using a computer, you are not the only one writing to your disk drive! Surprisingly your disk drive contains a lot of juicy information that can reveal a lot of secrets and history about what you did in the past. There are also places where data can be deliberately hidden by malicious software and it would be great to know what those are and how to pull information from them.
We will look at the places used by the system to perform its internal operations as well. Come and see what kind of information is stored on your disk drive as without this you will never be sure how to protect it! Have a cup of coffee before attending as your brain will be melted! You are welcome!

sessions.title: Azure as the Internet for Things
sessions.description: There are many definitions on what The Internet of Things exactly means but what they all have in common is that it is about a lot of devices and a lot of data. This session is about how Azure opens up its gates to help organizations deliver on the promise of IoT. During the session we follow the journey of a (data) message send from a device through an IoT architecture that ends up in the cloud and can give a business new insights and support in making intelligent decisions. References from the field will reveal some pitfalls and how they can be avoided. Topic discussed will be: Multi-platform devices, OSS, IoT Hub & Event Hub, (Advanced) Stream Analytics and Cortana Intelligence Suite. This session target developers, architect and technical decision makers.

sessions.title: Logging in the age of Microservices and the Cloud
sessions.description:
The days of the statically partitioned datacenter are over. Welcome to
the modern world of microservices and auto-scaling in the cloud.
Requests flow through multiple services, individual services are
auto-scaled and machines are short-lived.

This is a brave new world and it is time to change the way we design
and architect our software to better deal with it. In this talk we'll
look at logging and we'll take a deep dive into the challenges
involved into moving from the old "SSH and tail -f" world to a world
of centralized and structured logs, consumable both by humans and
machines.

This sessions is for developers and architects looking for
battle-tested solutions to implement effective logging for
microservices in an auto-scaling world.

sessions.title: Stretching your database beyond datacentre: deep-dive into features of hybrid environment
sessions.description: Hybrid IT infrastructure is the feature of IT environments. It provides both security of your data on premise with the high availability and resiliency provided by cloud solutions. In this session you will learn how to securely integrate your on premise SQL Servers with Azure SQL Database and SQL Servers on Azure VM’s. We will focus especially on new feature SQL Server stretched database which makes warm and cold data available to users at low cost. You can move your long retention data to the cloud where storage can be up to 40 percent less expensive than adding more enterprise storage solutions on premise! Caution: this will be intense, demo full session with strong focus on data security at all times.

sessions.title: Big Data and Advanced Analytics in Azure
sessions.description: In this session we will explore the options to run Big Data and Advanced Analytics solutions in Azure. In particular we will be looking at the Cortana Intelligence Suite, discuss its components and provide samples of how the technology can be used to create innovative solutions

sessions.title: Lunch break in the restaurant
DDD and the Delicate Art of Building Software
sessions.description: Introduced over a decade ago, DDD has evolved in many ways to follow the evolution of business and technology. Centered around the concept of a software model for the business domain, DDD has been often simplified as having an object-oriented model for a section of the business domain. A more modern view of DDD, however, moves the accent onto a different part of the DDD theory—the strategic design patterns—which definitely help in keeping a software project right on track. In this talk, we’ll discover theory and practice of the Ubiquitous Language and the theoretical and practical boundaries of a Bounded Context and its relationship to a popular buzzword like microservice.

sessions.title: Latency sensitive Microservices in Java
sessions.description: In this talk we explore how Microservices and Trading System overlap and what they can learn from each other as well as the strategies they have in common. In particular, how can we make microservices easy to test and performant and how can Trading System have shorter time to market and easier to maintain.

sessions.title: Fun and Practical JavaScript
sessions.description: We love the elegance of well designed code, but we are keen on being practical in every aspect of our work. Most of the times, we have to chose between a practical solution and a fun solution. But what if we can achieve both in JavaScript? What if a multi-paradigm programming language is the key to achieve programmer happiness?

sessions.title: Escaping JHell with JShell in Java 9
sessions.description:
The Java Core Libraries are mature, well-understood and loved, but don’t you always run into corner cases where they don’t work so well? In this talk, which is entirely live-coded, you will learn key updates and improvements that you’ll get to enjoy in the next exciting version of Java: Java 9. You will also get to see the new REPL - JShell in action as an educational tool. In this session you will learn about:

Collection factories
Improvements to Streams and Collectors
Improvements to Optional Data Type

If you’ve already heard a lot about project Jigsaw and want to know about what other Java 9 updates will rock your world, come to this talk!

sessions.title: A very opinionated proposal of a better architecture for modern applications
sessions.description: I think the days of MVC + Rest are gone. Gone are also the numerous tries of frontend developers to replicate the successful Rails model in every major JavaScript framework. I believe today we have the tools, knowledge and software principles to build better, faster, reliable and scalable apps. And although definitely not a silver bullet, I'd like to share with you some of those ideas in the form of a high-level architectural proposal that can be applied to almost every modern app.

sessions.title: Scaling web apps to a billion hits a day
sessions.description: Come to this session if you want to hear about real-world consulting experiences in scaling web apps, including insights and best practices. You’ll learn how to architect and develop applications on the ASP.NET stack so that they are easy to scale. This session includes but is not limited to queuing systems, SQL Server, REST APIs, Microsoft Azure, polyglot persistence, TCP, HTTP, vertical and horizontal scaling, partitioning, and NoSQL. The speaker’s consulting company has a 100% track record of successful projects on-budget, on-time.

sessions.title: Immutable Infrastructure: Rise of the Machine Images
sessions.description:
The cloud is the new normal and it is time to rethink how we see
machines and deployments. We have been piling layer upon layer of
complexity for too long. But why should it be this way? It is time to
radically simplify all this.

In this talk, we'll throw general-purpose operating systems, snowflake
servers and runtime provisioning out the door. Instead you'll see how
servers become disposable, how machine images are generated from
scratch in seconds and how to achieve perfect environment parity from
dev to prod.

This is Immutable Infrastructure. It is a profoundly important change
as to how we view and treat our systems. We'll go deep. We'll look at
how this affects scaling, logging, sessions, configuration, service
discovery and more. We'll also look at how containers and machine
images compare and why some things you took for granted may not be
necessary anymore.

But beware, neither sacred cows nor kittens will be spared!

sessions.title: The Performance Investigator's Field Guide
sessions.description: After hundreds of performance investigations, some patterns begin to emerge. You could save a lot of time here, or find the root cause more easily there. In this talk, you'll see what I learned from years of performance work in the field, which processes and tools work, and what I think can still be improved. First, we'll talk about anti-methods for performance investigations and the USE checklist for finding the performance bottleneck, applied specifically to Windows and .NET applications. Then, we'll talk about ideal performance investigation tools and which tools can satisfy these needs today, and review the power of Event Tracing for Windows for extracting hard-to-find information out of the system. Finally, we'll talk about dashboards and visualizations, and where the gaps are between figuring out an issue on one system and monitoring thousands of servers. Along the way, I'll take you on a tour of a couple of my most challenging performance investigations.

sessions.title: Data Driven UI
sessions.description: The technological advances in the web technologies combined with the flexibility  of modern frontend libraries led to a huge business demand of web applications. The session focuses on another way of looking at frontend development taking a real life scenario as an example.

sessions.title: Docker on Azure
sessions.description: Docker all the things! In this talk we'll talk about Docker, explain how it can be used and what are its benefits. We'll see how to deploy a Docker container on Azure, explore different orchestration options and demo how to do continuous integration and continuous deployment using Azure Container Service.

sessions.title: About the impact of AI, AR and VR on User Interfaces
sessions.description:
In this talk I will  present some trends which will shape new forms of interaction  between users and machines.

The raise of advanced technologies such as AI and AR/VR  will disrupt the way end users interact with technology.

As developers we will have to adapt and reinvent our way of thinking and building software . The talk will focus on these new exciting challenges.

sessions.title: Profiling Node Applications
sessions.description: Node runs on a powerful JavaScript engine, but that same engine can complicate things when it comes to obtaining accurate information on your application's performance. There are plenty of tools for profiling C++ or Java applications, but understanding JavaScript interactions with native code can be extremely challenging. In this talk we will discuss profiling options for Node.js, including perf_events, dtrace, the V8's engine built-in --prof switch, and tools based on the bleeding-edge kernel BPF technology. We will also talk about turning profiler results into flame graphs, an innovative visualization tool for understanding stack sample reports, and for figuring out the time split across the JavaScript and native parts of your application.

sessions.title: Registration & Welcome coffee
State of the nation: What will the future bring us?
Break
Rolul lui Tom Sawyer in Project Management
sessions.description: Tom Sawyer este un personaj creat de Mark Twain in anul 1876, care avea printre altele o abilitate deosebita, despre care vom discuta in prezentare. Managementul de Proiect este o disciplina aparuta in anii 1950, deci intre Tom Sawyer si Project Management nu exista nicio legatura. Sau ... exista??

sessions.title: The magic behind HTTP/2
sessions.description: Despite the fact H2 has been around for a while, too few implementations emerged and adoption is kind of slow in my opinion. This session aims to shed some light over what H2 is and how is it different than HTTP/1.1. So let's together unlock yet another door towards a more performant client/server communication model and discover how we can fully use it.

sessions.title: Who's my f... customer?
sessions.description: We all believe we know who's our customer. We all prepare our "Persona" but we must look more deep than a simple persona or end user profile. The presentation is based on two applied case studies which emphasis the importance and the need of a real customer persona.

sessions.title: The Art of Clean Code
sessions.description:
Whatever paradigm, language, technology stack or devops strategy is used, we will always write code. And that code will need to be understood, maintained and evolved by various developers for many years, hopefully. It will be read 10x more time than it took to write it!
Then, tell me, how do you write your code ?
Stop rushing, and start writing professional code. You'll need to learn to introspect your design, to make it express your thoughts in code. It may take years of practice to reach that point, but the path starts with some basic guidelines and 'code smells' that you ought to know, along with a core toolset of refactoring techniques.
As simple as some of these might seem, they will become the starting point of a lot of discussions about core principles of good software design, such as DRY, SRP, DIP, and KISS. Come and enjoy an entertaining, tangible presentation of key concepts in Clean Code, that will allow you to easily coach others, back at work.
Looking forward to share my passion with you: writing expressive code that is a pleasure to work with.
PS: In the end, let's talk a bit about writing clean code using Java8 lambdas/Streams, shall we? :)

sessions.title: Automate your UI testing for Android and iOS apps with the Xamarin Test Cloud
sessions.description: You've done a nice job building your new mobile app - but are your users going to stick around enough to actually use it? Research shows that two thirds of users will quickly abandon your app if it doesn't work great for them. But with hundreds of iOS and Android devices out there, can you reasonably expect to test your app on all of them? Enter Xamarin Test Cloud: a service to help you automate mobile testing on actual, physical devices, improve your app's quality, and give your users that great first impression - all without leaving your own desk.

sessions.title: Dynamic routing in microservice oriented applications
sessions.description: When splitting an application into different micro-services and each application access URL is dynamically generated, the hell gets loose. If you are tired of manually setting a route in your ngnix, come see linkerd in action.

sessions.title: Putting the Human Factor into Continuous Delivery
sessions.description:
In today’s software ecosystem many software companies are between 2 worlds, with a mature monolith that is gradually transforming into micro services and wanting to get to production as soon as possible and embracing the journey to continuous delivery. This path requires new engineering practices but also leaves us in a continuous changing world as new architectures and ways of working will emerge as soon as, if not before we’ll get to the current destination. 
In this presentation we’ll explore how all the human factor has an equally important role to play in all this.

sessions.title: UX Fueled Technology: Driving the Evolution of Business
sessions.description:
Controlling the User Experience has quickly become the priority for most businesses as they digitally mature.  As a result, the advancement of UX-focused technologies is rapidly accelerating.  

Learn about the journey mobile interfaces, AI, augmented / virtual reality, and invisible interactions, have taken from their inception – how UX focused business needs have given them the opportunity and path to become mainstream – and how they will be the basis of the newest wave of UX fueled technologies as we move into the next decade.

sessions.title: Predict the future in 5 minutes or less - an introduction to Azure Machine Learning
sessions.description: Work in progress

sessions.title: Reactive world in Android
sessions.description:
The focus of the presentation will be on the reactive approach in Android. 

The overall agenda of the presentation is at follows:
• Overview of reactive programming
• Reactive approach advantages over an classic approach
• Introducing RxJava in Android
• RxJava in Android applicability
• Combining Java8 features with RxJava
• How to structure applications that approach the reactive way
•Short demo demonstrating the theory and how to use RxJava

The presentation will focus on explaining how things work behind the scene and the demo will come as an complementary step in order to show how the theory can be actually put in practice.

The presentation will require people to have interacted and used Java and Android.

sessions.title: Enabling Infrastructure Automation - AWS with TerraForm and Ansible
sessions.description:
DevOps is a hot topic right now, you simply can’t ignore it anymore in 2017

Lets discover how DevOps should help your product: why it is good to have all your infrastructure in code, to be able to track all the changes, how immutable deploys make your life easier because all the environments are reproducible and they don’t rely on any existing state and how to pick up relevant alerts and monitoring. On the demo side you will be able to discover 2 very powerful tools to help you automate your cloud infrastructure: Terraform and Ansible. Terraform does a great job at infrastructure provisioning the artifacts that are more statical: like VPCs, security groups, load balancers, DNS entries, queues. With it you can easily codify your infrastructure and keep it in source control. While Ansible makes the connection between all the existing cloud infrastructure and provisioning of your virtual machines: starting them, finding them dynamically, installing your apps, monitoring of the vm and apps, releasing the vms, all the stuff needed for immutable deploys.

sessions.title: Breaking a Startup
sessions.description:
-Start-up Basics despre primii pasi pe care ar trebui sa ii avem in vedere cand incepem un start-up
-Puncte despre incubatoare si concursuri, fonduri europene, etc.
-Despre MVP
-Cum alegem parteneriate, cum studiem piata si ne cum  definim targetul.
-Epic initial fails (exemple cu start-up’uri de succes)

sessions.title: Scaling Agile or Agile at Scale?
sessions.description:
This is going to be an interactive workshop.

First, we will be comparing 2 main large scale Scrum flavors - Craig Larman and Bass Vodde's  LeSS and Brian Harry's "love letter to Scrum"( the Microsoft Scrum). Then, we will try  to figure out how can we apply these 2 great transformation experiences in introducing radical management to big IT (and non-IT)  shops.

sessions.title: Javascript Development Today
sessions.description: From package managers, build tools to the latest in frameworks & libraries. What do you have to know to do Javascript Development today.

sessions.title: Mobile Performance Strategies
sessions.description: I'll present the most common performance issues found in the mobile development and how to test and overcome them. The presentation will be technical and it will be based on my experience and the latest scientific research in the field.

sessions.title: Apache Camel - extending legacy systems
sessions.description: Will talk about Apache Camel: what it is and how can you use it to extend a legacy system.

sessions.title: Run-time Service Injection in distributed systems
sessions.description: Run-time Service Injection provides a mechanism which allows you to dynamically plumb together service endpoints within your application; which facilitates implementing features like A/B testing, branching by abstraction and assists when breaking larger services into smaller services.

sessions.title: Why and How to use Webpack
sessions.description: Ce este webpack, de ce l-am folosi, avantaje vs dezavantaje si cum am putea migra procesul de build spre unul bazat pe aceasta unealta

sessions.title: Look Mommy, No GC!
sessions.description: The .NET garbage collector can be your best friend or your worst enemy; and it’s not friendly with a lot of people. The GC left more than a few production systems burning in smoke after developers failed to anticipate the effects of real production loads on the memory subsystem. In this talk, we will methodically measure and improve the .NET garbage collector’s performance. We will begin with a quick refresher on dynamic performance tools that can identify GC issues: CLR performance counters, ETW GC events, and ETW object allocation events; as well as static analysis tools, such as the Roslyn-based heap allocations analyzer. Then, we will inspect multiple issues at the source code level: excessive boxing, unintended effects of lambdas closing over local variables, await-generated state machines, intermediate objects in LINQ queries, and many others. We will also discuss higher-level memory problems: how to get rid of large object allocations, how to avoid finalization, and how to convert heap-based designs to local objects. Some of these ideas are now being applied at the language and framework level in C# 7 and .NET Core. At the end of the talk, you will be equipped to reduce memory traffic and GC overhead in your own applications, often by a factor of 10 or more!

sessions.title: Modular Web Development
sessions.description:
The WHY,  HOW and WHEN of modular development. 
A look across different methods of reaching a modular code base, be it through libraries, frameworks or patterns.
WHY do we need it
HOW do we reach it
WHEN to implement it

sessions.title: Spice up your mobile apps with Speech API from Microsoft Cognitive Services
sessions.description: Bing Speech API is a RESTful service from Microsoft Cognitive Services which offers Speech-To-Text, Text-To-Speech and Speech Intent Recognition. We will build (using snippets) a Xamarin Forms application that will get voice input as a wav file and feed it into the Bing Speech API to get the text from the audio file. This can be done using a basic REST API client but we will do it via Xamarin Forms .NET SDK.

sessions.title: The Comfort Zone Myth
sessions.description: It didn’t take too much time to understand there isn’t a lot of science in what many managers, coaches or leaders preach. At first, I was surprised. Soon, I understood that most of the literature in the personal development field doesn’t serve the readers, but the authors. What does it mean to step out of the comfort zone? Is there any good reason to do so? This is a talk about performance through safety and happiness.

sessions.title: Mobile Testing Challenges and How to Overcome Them
sessions.description: When it comes to Mobile Testing the list of challenges encountered by testers is quite overwhelming. OS and device fragmentation, data consumption, available system resources and battery life are just a few to take in consideration. What's even more important are the solutions that we can taylor for particular projects in order to minimize the impact of these challenges on our day to day work.

sessions.title: The Future of Fab Automation
sessions.description:
In a few steps, what does it mean to integrate a Production Line.
Challenges of integrating Equipment that need to work 24/7
which manufactures high quality products.
An enthusiastic overview on how software development
contributes to the progress of building better products.

sessions.title: Lunch break
Continuous Integration in 30 minutes
sessions.description:
A demonstration of configurations of CI system with: running a build, running unit test and code coverage checks, deployment to an AWS VM, Pull Requests with Gated Check-ins  and Code Review,
with tools like Visual Studio Team Services, MSBuild, Git, MSDeploy. All done for a .NET web application.
Audience: specially for .NET developers, but also anyone willing to know more about basic CI.

sessions.title: Adaptability in the QA Engineering field
sessions.description: Adaptability is one of the key characteristics for survival and this definitely also applies to the dynamical field of QA Engineering. Where did this field appear from? How was it at the beginning and where is it now? But most importantly: Where is it going? Where will the testers be in a couple of years? What tools should they manage? These are a couple of questions that I would like to address and also talk about the challenges we will encounter, what are the predictions for the following years and how can we adapt. The QA is no longer a resource that can be allocated to any type of project and, technology now matters, EVEN for the QA.

sessions.title: Arhitectura CSS pentru aplicatii si site-uri medii
sessions.description:
Cu totii am ajuns la un moment dat in punctul de a lucra dupa alti programatori. Sunt intalnite deseori situatii cand din cauza arhitecturii CSS, apar buguri sau "pica" site ul/aplicatia in alta parte sau pe alta pagina. Subiectele abordate vor fi:
1. Cum lucram curat si pe elemente
2. Cum sa structurezi fisierele CSS si codul CSS cand lucrezi la aplicatii sau site-uri simple.
3. Clase refolosibile si unde sa le folosim
4. Beneficiile folosirii de librarii ca bootstrap
5. Preprocesoare (SASS, LESS) si de ce e bine sa le folosim.
6. Curatarea CSS ului cand se renunta la elemente sau se sterg anumite parti din site.
7. La final, 2 intrebari simple dar ce dau de gandit. Cine raspunde corect, va primi cate o carte de programare din partea mea.

sessions.title: Are we going to survive AI?
sessions.description: About the unprecedented technological, economical, social and political changes that the rise of AI and automation is going to bring and the enormously difficult task of not having society break down because of it.

sessions.title: Agnostic Project Management - A Systems Thinking Approach
sessions.description:
There is a deeply ingrained stereotype and misconception that there is a binary and mutually-exclusive choice between “Agile” and “Waterfall” and you need to force-fit your projects and business environment to one of those extremes. And there is a lot of emotional energy and dogma about which approach to use.

Arguments about what is the right way and what should never be done have escalated to almost religious war status.

Join me to explore a fresh new perspective where “Agile” and “Waterfall” are seen as complementary approaches rather than competitive. I will help you begin to develop a broader, high-impact view, focused on maximizing business value using whatever blend of approaches is most appropriate for a given situation.

sessions.title: The making of proper 3D models for video games
sessions.description:
An overview of the entire process that is required to make serious models for video games and more. It also covers advanced concepts like sculpting, texture painting and more. 

It aims to provide a starting point for those interested in making 3D models.

sessions.title: AI Systems
sessions.description: Learn and understand about the new types of machine learning techniques, from the Gradient Descent to Genetic Algorithms and how these algorithms can be applied to solve some real world problems.

sessions.title: Progressive Web Apps
sessions.description:
The future of Web apps was implemented yesterday and now it's ours to explore! And explore we shall,  because in this presentation we'll discover what are Progressive Web Apps and how are they changing the Web we know. Hope you're as excited as I am!

Alex :)

sessions.title: Leading with emotional intelligence
sessions.description: Who is a better leader ? A leader who shouts at his team and is always under stress or a leader who stays calm and understands his teams ? Emotional intelligence is the key to becoming a more successful leader. Lets find out why it is so important and how we can increase our level of emotional intelligence to be better leaders.

sessions.title: Future of Technology. The 4th Industrial Revolution.
sessions.description:
Presenters : Andrei Mocanu & Ovidiu Bariz 
Session Title: Future of Technology. The 4th Industrial Revolution.
Language : Romanian
Duration : 45 min
Summary : Things will never move this slowly again. In order to survive, businesses will have to adapt and understand how to digitally transform themselves. But what if you don’t want to follow what others are doing and instead you want to lead the way? What is the next big trend that will hit IT? How about the other industries?

sessions.title: Introduction to Selenium grid with Docker
sessions.description:
Agenda:
  
 - What is Docker
 - What are Containers
 - Versioning, Component re-use
 - Introduction to Selenium Grid with Docker
 - Initiating Docker selenium grid container setup
 - Writing Code for Selenium Grid to run on multiple containers in parallel
 - Setting Selenium grid setup using Docker compose
 - Scaling

sessions.title: Protecția datelor
sessions.description: Comisia europeană a elaborat anul trecut un regulament pentru protecția datelor valabil la nivel european, ce vine sa suprascrie legislațiile existente in țările comunitare. Sunt pregătire companiile pentru implementarea acestui regulament? Daca in cazul anumitor companii regulamentul nu se aplica, datele companiilor sunt in siguranța?

sessions.title: Changing e-com using Configurators 3D. New tools, new business models.
sessions.description:
Am trimis prezentarea pe care am tinut-o la business days Iasi in etapa dinainte
Nu pot face aceasta prezentare decat in ultima zi a conferintelor, adica pe 14 mai. Pe 13 noaptea ma intorc din Spania. 
Nu voi face aceasta prezentare decat daca sala are minim 100 de locuri.
O voi face in limba engleza si pana atunci voi adauga elemnte foarte bune. 

Configurators 3D este un business care a pronit din Iasi, este rezulatul unui proiect dezvoltat in ultimii 3 ani si o investitie de peste 500.000 euro.  printre clientii nostri sunt firme renumite din industria de lux precum si din alte industrii. 
In acest tools am integrat cele mai avansate toolsuri din industria jocurilor de calculator, echipa de programatori e formata din romani emigrati in Canada, senior level 3.
Activam pe niste piete foarte mari, unde costul personalizarii unui produs este foarte mare.
Utilizarea tools-urilor pe care le oferim, combinate cu optimizari, in special ale productiei, genereaza costuri de personalizare care tind spre zero.
Prin implementarea acestor noi tools-uri, multe din vechile metode de productie devin depasite.

sessions.title: Towards Automated Driving - the way to making it real
sessions.description: Short history of automated driving followed by an example of current technologies (Traffic Jam Assist) and a glimpse into the future technologies under development to reach fully automated vehicles.

sessions.title: Coffee Break
Open-Goverment, Open-Data
sessions.description: The talk shows what can be achieved with the current open-data platform offered by the Romanian government (http://data.gov.ro) and what are the international trends in this field.  Additionally, it gives a glimpse into the future of open administration platforms and what are the benefits for Romanian citizens.

sessions.title: Kick off Workshops - Diving into the unknown
sessions.description:
Requesting or even requiring a kick-off workshop, before starting a project, between stakeholders and the development team, is one of the variables that can lead your project on the path to success. 
In this type of meeting a common language is developed, goals are defined and expectations are set. Without them the project is left open to ambiguity, assumptions and miscommunication.
A well done kick off workshop sets the tone of the project.

sessions.title: ChatBots, introduction and use cases
Multi-model databases
sessions.description: A talk about multi-model databases, what are good for, why it's better than polyglot persistence. A look at ArangoDB and its js framework called Foxx which let's you build REST APIs directly inside the DB without connect calls for better performance.

sessions.title: Twelve-factor cloud app in action
sessions.description:
hen approaching on premise application development there is an entire literature on “how to do it right under any conditions”. But what’s the blueprint for a cloud app? I will discuss the answer by showing how each of the https://12factor.net influences a cloud-ready app, with Java&NodeJs demos.

Why should you do something different when your application is destined to be a SaaS or to exist within a PaaS?
Because this kind of application represents a solution composed of individually cooperating services that need coordination (usually achieved through DevOps Pipeline). The 12-factor app methodology (https://12factor.net) represents a best practice when comes to cloud application development and this presentation will detail and demonstrate each principle. You will see how you can easilly make a Java or NodeJs web application to be cloud-ready by following each of the 12 principles.

sessions.title: IT Shift - A Software Testing Career
sessions.description:
The degree of graduating students that will work in the pursued domain is critically low in Romania. A study shows that  80% of the youth that finish some form of Higher Education does not work in the same domain of activity.

This talk is intended for the persons who are in those 80% and are thinking of shifting to the IT domain.

How do I get in it? Is it hard? How easy is to be employed if you don't have an IT bachelor diploma? Why did you chose Software Testing?

These are some questions that will be answered and much more.

sessions.title: Dependency Injection Design Patterns
sessions.description: I'll speak about 4 DI Design Patterns: constructor injection, property injection, method injection, ambient context. How to choose one, over another; what should you be careful about. Bonus: choosing the right DI pattern cheat sheet.

sessions.title: Gotta catch (and keep) them all!
sessions.description:
We all hope that our product launch will be a smashing success and surpass our goals, but what happens after that? 

Let's find out how we can build, engage and interact with our user communities.

We will take a crash course into how marketing can benefit a product launch and development of the IT sector.

sessions.title: Biometrics is here to stay – is the Romanian market prepared for it?
sessions.description: Statistics show that over 600 million mobile devices worldwide will use biometric authentication by 2021, with the technology moving beyond just fingerprints, to include voice and facial recognition. Yet, how many of individuals really understand what exactly biometric authentication is and which are the implications of using it? Apart from the fact that it is extremely convenient, of course. After all, we carry our biometrics with us every day, wherever we go, therefore, we do not have to worry about forgetting them.

sessions.title: Cloud Security. Dude , where is my data!?
sessions.description:
Believe it or not, but cloud is not really a black box anymore. Cloud managed data is the new reality and security could be one of the milestones when deciding to move forward. 

Let's demystify cloud security together and see how we can protect our data in cloud and what is the current market offering from this perspective!

sessions.title: Cinema City App Concept Case Study
sessions.description: Voi prezenta intregul studiu de caz, toti pasii ce au stat la baza acestui concept. De la motivele si probleme ce incerc sa le rezolv, new trends, new features, persona, user flows, flow map, sketches, high fidelity design cu fiecare ecran detaliat si explicat. Voi incheia cu prezentarea video a intregii aplicatii, un flow ce va trece prin toti pasii si toate ecranele. La final veti putea testa live aplicatia, direct pe telefon, veti putea intra pe un link cu un prototip in Marvel.

sessions.title: The Raffle: Come to Room 2 and Win Your Prizes!
Cocktail & Business Networking - Partners, Speakers, Special Guests
The entire Codecamp community - After party - downtown

speakers.name: Axel Fontaine
speakers.bio:
Axel is a Continuous Delivery and Immutable Infrastructure expert, a JavaOne Rockstar and a regular speaker at many large international conferences including JavaOne, Devoxx, Jfokus, JavaZone, QCon, JAX, ...

He is the founder and CEO of Boxfuse (boxfuse.com), the easiest way to deploy JVM and Node.js applications to AWS and also the creator and project lead of Flyway (flywaydb.org).

speakers.name: Raoul-Gabriel Urma
speakers.bio: Raoul-Gabriel Urma is CEO and co-founder of Cambridge Spark, a leading learning community for data scientists and developers in UK. In addition, he is also Chairman and co-founder of Cambridge Coding Academy, a growing community of young coders and pre-university students. Raoul is author of the bestselling programming book “Java 8 in Action” which sold over 20,000 copies globally. Raoul completed a PhD in Computer Science at the University of Cambridge.

speakers.name: Dino Esposito
speakers.bio: Since 2003, Dino has been the voice of Microsoft Press to Web developers and the author of many popular books on ASP.NET and software architecture. In particular, Dino authored “Architecting Applications for the Enterprise” with fellow MVP Andrea Saltarello and “Modern Web Development” and has “Programming ASP.NET Core” in the works for 2017. When not training, Dino serves as the CTO of Crionet—a fast growing firm that specializes in Web and mobile solutions for the world of professional sports.

speakers.name: Sasha Goldshtein
speakers.jobTitle: Microsoft MVP, Consultant and Trainer, CTO
speakers.bio: Sasha Goldshtein is the CTO of Sela Group, a Microsoft C# MVP and Azure MRS, a Pluralsight author, and an international consultant and trainer. Sasha is the author of two books, a prolific blogger and open source contributor, and author of numerous training courses. His consulting work revolves mainly around distributed architecture, production debugging and performance diagnostics, and mobile application development.

speakers.name: Greg Tworek
speakers.jobTitle: Microsoft Security Trusted Advisor, Director of CQURE
speakers.bio:
Greg has been working with Windows Security since the very beginning of his professional career. He started as a system administrator, then moved to a consultant role, IT manager and chief information security officer (CISO). Now he is mainly responsible for consulting services delivered worldwide by CQURE.
He has access to a source code of Windows.

speakers.name: Valery Jacobs
speakers.bio: As a Technical Evangelist at Microsoft Valery works with partners to get the most out of new technology and to leverage the potential of the cloud. With a focus on Azure,  Internet of Things and Blockchain technology Valery gets his energy and inspiration also from the maker community and it’s potential to shape the future of both hardware and software development. With more than 16 years working in the field of software development, Valery brings with him the experience of national and internat

speakers.name: Vlad "Reign" Zelinschi
speakers.bio: Reign is a pragmatic frontend engineer, Google Developer Expert and an avid caffeine consumer. He loves surrounding himself with ever smiling people and he's constantly pushing his limits in order to become a better professional. It's worth saying that his two full sleeve tattoos are not the direct consequence of him being present in the IT industry for more than 5 years now. He is currently employed as a as a Technical Lead, striving to make the world a better place.

speakers.name: Chander Dhall
speakers.jobTitle: Microsoft MVP, ASP.NET Insider, Technology leader
speakers.bio: Chander Dhall is an awarded Microsoft MVP and world-renowned technology leader in architecting and implementing solutions. As a Microsoft Azure Advisor, ASP.NET Insider, Web API Advisor, DocumentDB Advisor, and an MVP for Visual Studio and Development Technologies, Chander has insight into new releases on technologies used by millions of developers. His critical advice, impeccable vision, futuristic strategy backed with best practices in the industry are reasons for his unparalleled success.

speakers.name: Peter Lawrey
speakers.jobTitle: Java consultant in the low latency space, Java Champion
speakers.bio: Peter Lawrey likes to inspire developers to improve the craftmanship of their solutions, engineer their systems for simplicity and performance, and enjoy their work more by being creative and innovative. He has a popular blog “Vanilla Java” which gets 120K views per month, he is the third on StackOverflow for Java, the founder of the Performance Java UG, and the lead developer of OpenHFT, open source software used by Investment Banks, trading houses and hedge funds.

speakers.name: Sorin Peste
speakers.bio:
Sorin has been a part of the large Microsoft family since 2011, and has been busy developing software on the Microsoft stack since 2001. 
As a Technical Evangelist he engages with developers and IT Professionals, showcasing the latest and greatest Microsoft solutions and technology.

He has delivered a number of enterprise solutions, both on premises and in the cloud. 

Sorin likes coding, travelling and riding his motorcycle in his spare time.

speakers.name: Adrian (Adelin) Stoica
speakers.bio: Founded Jamstudy from Innovation Labs (2015 Edition)

speakers.bio: Coder, blogger and tech enthusiast in general, passionate about JavaScript and Functional Programming, Alex works as a Full Stack Developer and is heavily involved into the JavaScript community, co-organizing Cluj JavaScripters. He always puts passion first in all his endeavours and is a militant for clean code and quality software development.

speakers.name: Alexandru Ciobanu

speakers.bio: Alex is a Software Engineer. He wants to share his experience with setting up Continuous Integration with Visual Studio Team Services, to help .NET and other developers setup quickly the build system.

speakers.name: Alexandru Pavaloi
speakers.bio: Well...fuck the regular "i am 22 years old and passionate about programming". I am gonna tell you that programming is what I do in my busy-time. Because in my free time I'm all about challenges and awesome things. Building cars, starring in movies or tandem skydiving. And my newest challenge is speaking for the CodeCamp conference! Wanna help me do that?

speakers.bio: Cu peste 10 ani de carieră în domeniul IT, Ana este Site Manager al Softvision Iași. După 7 ani petrecuți pe partea de development, a trecut în zona de management unde a condus mai multe proiecte și echipe de success.

Recently, my technical passion for cloud application development has been badged with IBM Certified Application Developer - Cloud Platform v1; and I would like to share with the audience my experience and experiments. 

My other passions? The usual knowledge hunt through reading and growing fashion skills through shopping.

He followed a PhD in Computer Science at Delft University of Technology and was an entrepreneur for a short while. He likes complex data analysis and tinkering with various computer-related toys using Python. Outside of the office, Andrei spends time in libraries and visiting friends across the world.

Bogdan 
is a .NET engineer having 10 years experience.  He has a passion for automation and quality programming and wants to show how Visual Studio Team Services can help any .NET application to quickly have Continuous Integration Setup with all the basic necessary steps.

She is also a trainer and  coach, actively involved in the IT community.

speakers.name: Dimitris-Ilias Gkanatsios

Spanning over a decade of experience in software business, his primary focus is to guide software houses and startups in Greece to use innovative cloud solutions and develop their business.  In the past, he has worked as a software engineer in leading software houses and as a CS professor in private universities. Feel free to view his blog at www.dgkanatsios.com

speakers.name: Dina Goldshtein
speakers.bio: Dina Goldshtein is a Senior Software Engineer at Aternity (recently acquired by Riverbed). Aternity builds performance monitoring tools that run on millions of PCs and mobile devices. Dina is on the team responsible for the core collection mechanism, which hooks low-level Windows events and collects performance information from a variety of sources. Since starting at Aternity, she worked a lot on boot performance monitoring, identifying bottlenecks in the Windows boot process.

As an agile advocate, he optimized business value delivered within various large scale organizations by implementing XP, Scrum, Kanban, LeSS.

În calitate de Digital Strategist la Grapefruit, a ajutat companii medii și mari să înțeleagă mediul digital și cum acesta poate fi folosit pentru a rezolva probleme reale de business.

He is a believer in the power that Agile and Lean thinking and techniques can bring to an organization. 

Life's big questions interest him most. When he is out of the office you can find him eating shawarma, sitting at a table near you. 

He has a self-proclaimed PhD in napping in any position you can think of.

I like to be up to date with new things that revolve around the IT industry.
I like to travel, read books and watch sci-fi movies.

Last year I decided to join the Cluj IT community by moving to the "Silicon Valley of Romania”.
I have a major in Computer Science and a master’s degree in Project Management.

speakers.name: Jeroen ter Heerdt

Dutch Data Dude He is passionate about "all things data"; whether it is about databases, data warehousing, BI, big data, data visualizations, self-service BI, Hadoop, real-time BI or anything even remotely related to data or insight.  He strives to apply these concepts in his life as much as possible. Jeroen combines enthusiasm, vision and hands-on experience into fresh, entertaining and thought-provoking talks.

speakers.name: Justin Marcucci
speakers.bio: As Chief Digital Officer, Justin is responsible for leading Endava’s global digital business, both from a client engagement and digital delivery capacity. The digital philosophy Justin has instilled within the organization is focused on enabling businesses to dramatically improve the experiences of their users through the introduction of technology, while giving them the strategy, data, and insight to evolve and succeed as the overall market landscape changes.

Solution architect, developer, data scientist and consultant. Michael designs and implements solutions for Databases, Network & Management area, mainly for Microsoft platform. Michael holds MCT, MCITP, MCTS SQL SERVER, MCTS .NET, MCDBA certifications and many others – especially database and
software development related. As for day-to-day work, he works as Solution Architect, designing and planning database related solutions and software, mainly based on Microsoft and Oracle servers.

speakers.name: Oana  Scutarasu

Born and forged in Iasi, ready to rule anywhere in the world.
Started IT carreer in Iasi at Capgemini in 2011, in 2012 joined SCC as Lvl 2 Support Analyst then moved to Microsoft as Support Escalation Engineer for Office365 Exchange Online.

Tri-cultural development manager with over 10 years of experience in SaaS architecture, UI architecture, product conception and development, and consulting for a wide range of clients in the public and private sectors.

Deep understanding of product innovation challenges in a mobile-first market. Effective quick product life-cycle engineering leadership fueled by accurate market reading, real-time product data analysis, data-driven decision-making, and implementation.

Mi-am inceput "cariera" de la varsta de 16 ani, atunci a fost "love at first sight" cu CTRL+U.
Programarea web este pe langa job, o pasiune si fac asta din placere. Am studiat filo si am terminat facultatea de economie. You see where I`m going .. Pun mare accent pe treaba buna facuta si pe cod maintainable.
Am trecut prin multe perioade ale front-end ului inclusiv perioada in care se foloseau tabele pentru structura site-ului.
Experienta mea in domeniu este de 4 ani front-end / 2 ani back-end

By now, I passed through some major areas (networking, service&administration, performance testing), so I have a good insight on how systems and applications behave. Iubeste fiecare secunda pe care o petrece lucrand la proiecte digitale si este specializat pe User Interface, designurile sale fiind bold si iesite din comun.

Java Engineer, Architect and Technical Lead at IBM.
Independent Trainer & Coach.

A passionate speaker, with a very entertaining presentation style, spiced with jokes, metaphors and easy-to-remember visuals, distilled throughout his huge experience training and coaching at top companies developing enterprise applications. 
Victor is currently guiding the corporate architecture for one of the largest clients of IBM Romania.

Vlad has been developing software in an unprofessional manner for over two decades. He has also developed software professionally for more than half of that time. Passionate about teaching complex topics and ideas, Vlad strives to keep his audience both educated and entertained. 
 
You should come to his presentation.
